clinical_study.brief_title: Trial Measuring the Clinical Impact of the FilmArray® Pneumonia Panel in Critically Ill
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Trial Measuring the Clinical Impact of the FilmArray® Pneumonia, a Prospective Interventional Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Cliniques universitaires Saint-Luc- Université Catholique de Louvain

clinical_study.source: Cliniques universitaires Saint-Luc- Université Catholique de Louvain

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to measure how the use of Film-Array Pneumonia (FA-PNEU) on respiratory samples of adult patients suspected of acute care pneumonia in the intensive care unit of Saint-Luc University Hospital can accelerate / improve the initiation of the optimal antibiotic treatment.

detailed_description.textblock:
The main objective of this trial is to confirm/attest/prove the following statement:
The use of the FilmArray Pneumonia panel on respiratory samples of critically ill suspected with pneumonia, enables a faster microbiological pneumonia diagnosis and an improved therapeutic management of the patient.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Open Randomized study, consecutive 2 weeks-period for observation group and study group

primary_outcome.time_frame: 48 hours from arrival of the respiratory sample at the laboratory
primary_outcome.description: Turn Around Time administration of optimal antimicrobial treatment

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 week from arrival of the respiratory sample at the laboratory
secondary_outcome.description: Microbiological performances FA-PNEU test versus routine microbiology testing

arm_group.description: Respiratory samples are treated according to routine laboratory testing : culture, immuno assays
Respiratory samples are treated according to routine laboratory testing : culture, immuno assays AND molecular testing (FilmArray PNEU) of the endotracheal aspirate sample 24 hours a day.

intervention.description: FilmArray Pneumonia testing of tracheal sample

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients 18 years, remaining at the intensive care of the Saint-Luc University Hospital
- Recently transferred from emergency care with Community acquired Pneumonia of grade 4 suspicion
- With a Ventilation acquired Pneumonia suspicion
Suspicion will be based on symptoms, clinical, biological and radiological criteria.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients from whom no respiratory sample can be obtained
- Patients benefitting from palliative care
- Insufficient volume of the respiratory sample after routine testing to perform the FA-PNEU test.
